intro: Commelina chayaensis, commonly known as the Chaya plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant features upright, branching stems with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically with three petals and three sepals. The plant is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
